title: Unite chief Len McCluskey denies claims he will quit 'early next year', amid ongoing power struggle in Labour
text:
Len McCluskey, the Unite union chief and key ally of Jeremy Corbyn, is preparing to step down early next year in a potential blow to the Labour leader, The Daily Telegraph has been told.

Mr McCluskey is said to have been involved in a power struggle with the shadow chancellor John McDonnell after his close friend Karie Murphy was forced out as Mr Corbyn’s chief of staff last week.

His departure would mean that two of the four powerbrokers closest to Mr Corbyn would have left his inner circle, in what would be interpreted as a victory for Mr McDonnell and the pro-Remain wing of the party.

Last night a spokesman for Mr McCluskey, whose union is Labour’s biggest donor, firmly denied the claims,...
description: Len McCluskey, the Unite union chief and key ally of Jeremy Corbyn, is preparing to step down early next year in a potential blow to the Labour leader, The Daily Telegraph has been told.
